perturbation.changed_text: "TERM" means the term as set out in Clause 7; however, the term may be shortened or extended at CEIS's sole discretion, subject to written notification to XFN.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'TERM' refers to Clause 7 for its duration. The modified definition introduces an exception allowing CEIS to unilaterally alter the term, contradicting the fixed term defined in Clause 7 and creating uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: During the Term, CEIS agrees not to appoint any other licensees for the distribution of the Content in the People's Republic of China.
perturbation.changed_text: During the Term, CEIS may appoint other licensees for the distribution of the Content in the People's Republic of China, provided that CEIS deems it necessary for market development. XFN's consent is encouraged but not required.
perturbation.explanation: The original text grants XFN non-exclusive rights in China, while ensuring CEIS will not appoint other licensees. The modified text directly contradicts this, allowing CEIS to appoint other licensees at its discretion, undermining XFN's rights and creating uncertainty about the exclusivity of their license, despite the clause stating the opposite.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement shall take effect from the Effective Date and continue in full force and effect for twenty (20) years thereafter, unless otherwise terminated in accordance with Clause 8.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement shall take effect from the Effective Date and continue in full force and effect for twenty (20) years thereafter, unless otherwise terminated in accordance with Clause 8. Notwithstanding the foregoing, CEIS reserves the right to terminate this agreement at any time, with or without cause, upon providing 30 days written notice to XFN. In such event, CEIS shall not be liable for any damages or losses incurred by XFN.
perturbation.explanation: The original text establishes a 20-year term subject to termination under Clause 8. The added sentence creates an additional termination right for CEIS, exercisable at any time without cause, which contradicts the initial 20-year term and makes Clause 8 potentially irrelevant.
